sn12.27:4.2: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.27:4.3: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.27:4.4: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.27:5.1: And what is old age and death?
sn12.27:5.2: The old age, decrepitude, broken teeth, grey hair, wrinkly skin, diminished vitality, and failing faculties of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.27:5.4: The passing away, perishing, disintegration, demise, mortality, death, decease, breaking up of the aggregates, and laying to rest of the corpse of the various sentient beings in the various orders of sentient beings.
sn12.27:5.6: Such is old age, and such is death.
sn12.27:5.7: This is called old age and death.
sn12.27:5.8: Rebirth is the origin of old age and death.
sn12.27:5.9: When rebirth ceases, old and age and death cease.
sn12.27:5.10: The practice that leads to the cessation of old age and death is simply this noble eightfold path,
sn12.27:5.12: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn12.27:6.7: And what are the six sense fields? …
sn12.27:6.8: And what are name and form? …
sn12.27:7.2: There are three kinds of choices.
sn12.27:7.3: Choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
sn12.27:7.5: Ignorance is the origin of choices.
sn12.27:7.7: The practice that leads to the cessation of choices is simply this noble eightfold path,
sn12.27:7.9: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn12.27:8.1: A noble disciple understands conditions, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
sn12.27:8.2: Such a noble disciple is called ‘one accomplished in view’, ‘one accomplished in vision’, ‘one who has come to the true teaching’, ‘one who sees this true teaching’, ‘one endowed with a trainee’s knowledge’, ‘one who has entered the stream of the teaching’, ‘a noble one with penetrative vision’, and ‘one who stands knocking at the door of the deathless’.”
